perturbation.original_text: 1.12 "Product" shall mean TARA-002 and any similar products.
perturbation.explanation: The original text defines 'Product' as TARA-002 and any similar products. Changing this to 'TARA-002 only' creates a contradiction if later sections discuss royalties or other aspects related to 'Product' potentially encompassing similar products. This introduces uncertainty about whether those clauses only pertain to TARA-002 or also to similar products.

perturbation.original_text: 4.2 License. University hereby grants to ArTara an exclusive license to use the Program Data solely for the Project and in Regulatory Filings in the Field in the Territory.
perturbation.changed_text: 4.2 License. University hereby grants to ArTara a non-exclusive license to use the Program Data solely for the Project and in Regulatory Filings in the Field in the Territory.
perturbation.explanation: The original text grants an 'exclusive' license. Changing this to 'non-exclusive' directly contradicts the initial grant. This creates uncertainty about whether the University can license the Program Data to other parties, impacting the value of ArTara's license and potentially leading to disputes.

perturbation.original_text: 8.1 Term. This Agreement may be terminated by ArTara upon thirty (30) days prior written notice to University.
perturbation.changed_text: 8.1 Term. This Agreement may be terminated by ArTara upon thirty (30) days prior written notice to University. University may terminate this agreement at any time with no notice to Artara.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states the conditions for termination by Artara. The change adds an allowance for the university to terminate the agreement at any time with no notice. This contradicts section 8.2, creating uncertainty about termination requirements.
